actions.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 102-159, by Mr. Moakley.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 2942. All points of order against provisions in the bill for failure to comply with the provisions of clauses 2 and 6 of rule XXI are waived. Measure will be read by section. Bill is open to amendments. It shall be in order to consider the amendments printed in the report of the Committee on Rules accompanying this resolution, if offered by the Member specified or his designee, and all points of order against the amendments for failure to comply with the provisions of clause 7 of rule XVI and clause 2 of rule XXI are waived.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 43.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate.
The previous question was ordered without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

official_title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2942) making appropriations for the Department of Transportation and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Waives points of order against the consideration of H.R. 2942 (Department of Transportation and related agencies funding).

titles.title: Waiving certain points of order during consideration of the bill (H.R. 2942) making appropriations for the Department of Transportation and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 1992, and for other purposes.
